bibl.title: Despatch from R. Dorsey Mohew to Josiah Quiney, November 29, 1893
Despatches from United States Consuls in Boma, 1888-1895
bibl.publisher: National Archives and Records Service General Services Administration

div1.p:
Commercial Agency of the United States Nyandu Lomami River Kongo Free State Lat 4:49: S. lONG 25'1-'30'e- Nov. 29, 1893
Honorable Josiah Quincey Assistant Secretary of State, Washington, D.C.
Sir: I have the honor to announce my arrival at this place November 26th, after fourteen days march from Lousambo, in the Jankuru River.
Congo Liutete mentioned in any dispatched of June 21st chief of the Arab past here was tried for treason during the month of September found quietly and state.
I leave tomorrow morning Nov. 30th for Nyangwe + Kassongo + Lake Tangayaka with a caravan of 750 people,+150 of whom are soldiers armed with Albini Rifles, the next are carrying
